title: Lindsey Trail - Lincolnshire Wolds Cycle Route

images.title: John Beal / Market Place, Market Rasen
images.caption: Market Place, Market Rasen. The route passes through this town at the northern end.

images.title: Richard Croft / Willingham Woods
images.caption: Willingham Woods. You'll follow woodland trails through these woods, located just south of Market Rasen.

images.title: Richard Croft / All Saints' church, Tealby, Lincs.
images.caption: All Saints' church, Tealby. You'll pass through this pretty village near Market Rasen. All Saints' church looks down on most of Tealby from the top of the hill. Norman tower with Perpendicular top, Early English and Decorated arcades, the chancel is by James Fowler in 1872.

images.title: Glebe Farm (disused!) in a hollow next to the Lindsey Trail by Chris, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Glebe Farm, in a hollow next to the Lindsey Trail

description: This new bridleway runs through the Lincolnshire Wolds AONB and is suitable for both walkers and cyclists with a hybrid or mountain bike. The route runs for just over 70 miles on fairly flat paths making it a reasonably easy cycle or walk. The trali mainly follows country lanes but there are off road sections too, notably in Willingham Woods just east of Market Rasen. The woods make a good start point for the route with a picnic area and large car park.
